Class Transaction

java.lang.Object
  Transaction

public class Transaction
extends Object

classTransaction: Allows creating objects containing the details of the Transaction. Imports the java.util packages for it's Date and Calender classes. Has constructor overloading to: -->Create a blank Transaction object:Transaction() -->Load a Transaction's details based on his Id:Transaction(int transId) -->Create a Transaction object with the data recieved as parameters: Transaction(int transId,String date, int custId, int fromPin, String toName, String toAddress, int toPin) Provides functionality save the data stored in the object into the Data class. -->Save() Provides functionality to prin the data stored in the object to the console. -->printDetails():Prints the details to the console -->printBill():Prints a bill for the transaction to the console.

Version:
1
Author:
Darezik Damekevala

          Initializes the Transaction object with dummy values.

Method Summary

          Prints the details stored in the transaction object in the form of a bill onto the console after calculating the cost and tax.

Stores the customer who made the transaction's id.

fromPinCode

int fromPinCode
Stores the Pin code from which the mail was sent.

sentDate

String sentDate
Stores the date the mail reached it's destination. In case the mail is not sent this field contans the String "Not Sent".

Stores the recipient's address.

Constructor Detail

Transaction

Transaction()
Initializes the Transaction object with dummy values.

Transaction

Transaction(int transId)
Initialises the Transaction object with values taken from the Data class. Takes in the transaction's Id as a parameter.

Transaction

Transaction(int transId,
            String date,
            int custId,
            int fromPin,
            String name,
            String address,
            int toPin,
            String sent)
Initialises the Transaction object with values recieved as parameters. The parameters are: -->transId:The transaction's Id. -->date:The date the transaction was made. -->custId:The customer who intitiated the transaction's Id. -->fromPin:The pin code the mail was posted from. -->name:The customer who intitiated the transaction's name. -->address:The address of the customer who initiated the transactinon. -->toPin:The pin code the mail was posted to. --sent:The date the mail was delivered or "Not Sent" if the mail is yet to be delivered.

Method Detail

printBill

void printBill()
Prints the details stored in the transaction object in the form of a bill onto the console after calculating the cost and tax.

printDetails

void printDetails()
Prints the details stored in the transaction object onto the console.

Save

void Save()
Saves the data stored in the object into the data class. In case the object was created using data from the Data class, it overwrites the data with which the object was created.
